The game is intended to be played in one sitting, over the course of two to four hours, by two to five players - a group of Investigators and one Host, who runs the game, creates challenges for the characters, and narrates the horrors as they unfold.

The players take on the roles of nineteenth-century occult investigators, and the Host describes their journey into the lair of an unknown Enemy. The aim of the game is to help the whole group tell an engaging, surprising story about venturing into a terrifying location, piecing together fragmented clues, and confronting the evil found within. The story might end with the characters triumphing and banishing the evil from this world. Equally it might end with the investigators devoured, body and soul, by terror.

boardgame.name: Blood Rage: Wolfman
boardgame.description:
A Kickstarter exclusive! The Wolfman comes with his figure and a card to add him to your Age II deck.

Card says:
Only monsters count their STR in a battle with this monster.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Blood Rage

boardgame.name: Hungry Gnolls Eat the Rich
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
Hungry Gnolls Eat the Rich is a 12-page rules-lite roleplaying game based on John Harper's Lasers and Feelings and Ron Edward's Trollbabes. It's about forces of chaos and community fighting back against an established power that has disenfranchised those values.

In it, players take on the role of a band of hyena-folk who have committed themselves to action. They have forfeited what little comfort and safety they could access in order to fight an unjust system because they are singularly, uncompromisingly, hungry. They see hunger all around them–and there is no greater injustice than hunger to a gnoll.

boardgame.name: Wingspan: Meeple Source 3D Printed Nests
boardgame.description: Set of four 3D printed nests for Wingspan, intended to hold eggs or resource tokens.

boardgame.name: Gone Hunting
boardgame.description:
A family friendly, light, board game for 1 - 4 Hunters. Create a custom hunting ground while you stalk, hunt, and harvest trophy animals to gain the most trophy points by the end of a 14 day Hunting season.

During each turn, Hunters will start by placing out a map tile and then gaining the bonuses from it. From there, each Hunter will take their turn spending 2 actions to Move, Scout, Hunt, or Buy.

Moving allows the Player to move to the different Tiles to get in Range of animals to Hunt. While you can shoot father than your Range, there is a penalty for taking the long shot.

Scouting allows the Hunter to look at the facedown animals on a tile within their Range or place a new Animal on a Tile.

Hunting is where you take the dice from your weapon, equipment, and any that you have gained/saved and roll them hoping to score enough Shots to take the animal down.

Buying allows you to purchase equipment or even a canine companion from the Store, grab some important Ammo dice, or turn in a completed Trophy card for more Trophy points and other bonuses!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Roar: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
Roar The Card Game puts you in charge of your very own dinosaur park. In this 2-4 player game you will compete against other players to build the best dinosaur park over the Cretaceous, Jurassic, and Triassic periods. But watch out an extinction event can disrupt your plans at any moment, and dinosaurs running around outside of your park are bad business.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dinodeck
boardgame.description: A Top Trumps style comparison card game about dinosaurs. The acting player chooses which category to compare (height, weight or speed), the players choose cards from their hands and the highest value wins all the cards. Replacement cards are drawn and when the deck runs out, the player with the most cards won wins the game.

boardgame.name: Alter
boardgame.description:
Alter is a 52 card deck game of strategy, bluffing, and a bit of luck. Count the value of your cards to get to 21, but can you get there when the value of your cards change?

The value of cards can be changed with either an "Alter" or "Revert" card. The object of the game is to reach 21 by the beginning of your turn, meaning even if you have 21 points it can still change.

You can either try to win by getting to 21, or outlast all the other players until the deck runs out and highest score wins.

Card values are kept track of by a card counter and tokens, which are provided with the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Asuntos Internos (Número 1 - Abr 1995)
boardgame.description:
User Summary:

Asuntos Internos fue una revista de aparición trimestral (aunque no se llegó a cumplir la periodicidad prevista), editada por Ludotecnia y distribuida por Distrimagen S.L.
Estaba principalmente enfocada a juegos de la propia editorial.

En la sección de "Artículos" se desglosa el contenido de este número.
boardgame.rpg: Ragnarok (Juego De Horror En el Mundo Contemporáneo)

boardgame.name: Asuntos Internos (Número 2 - Sep 1995)
boardgame.description:
User Summary:

Asuntos Internos fue una revista de aparición trimestral (aunque no se llegó a cumplir la periodicidad prevista), editada por Ludotecnia y distribuida por Distrimagen S.L.
Estaba principalmente enfocada a juegos de la propia editorial.

En la sección de "Artículos" se desglosa el contenido de este número.
boardgame.rpg: Ragnarok (Juego De Horror En el Mundo Contemporáneo)

boardgame.name: Xenopolitan
boardgame.description:
Xenopolitan is an RPG about everyday life in an alien metropolis. Live the life of an extraterrestrial person with real world problems. Play as a human or extraterrestrial entrepreneur, student, artist, social worker, politician, reporter, criminal, detective, or anything else, and experience life in this galactic futurescape.

Setting: The year is 2099. Ingress is a city with 90 million people from thousands of different species and planets. It flies in the skies above Earth and is a hub for extraterrestrials conducting business with various Earthling corporations and governments. Players are denizens of this sprawling, cosmopolitan city, and their backgrounds and goals can be as diverse as the city’s population.

System: Xenopolitan is a complete game based on the popular Fudge system. The rules are fast, flexible, and easy to learn. The broad skill system enables game masters and players to tell a wide variety of stories and create characters from all walks of life. Players might be reporters for a media corporation, members of a rock band, or partners in a law firm. The possibilities are as vast as real life.

Features:

Players can easily create their own extraterrestrial species by combining various advantages, drawbacks, and psychic powers. Want to play a parasitic bacteria or a being of pure energy? It’s quickly done with Xenopolitan’s fun, creative character creation system.

Xenopolitan’s conflict resolution system can generate non-binary results with interesting complications and encourages active participation from players.

Xenopolitan supports many different styles of play and includes numerous story ideas for one-shot sessions or full campaigns.

Pages upon pages of groovy artwork with cool aliens!

boardgame.name: Asuntos Internos (Número 3 - Oct 1996)
boardgame.description:
User Summary:

Asuntos Internos fue una revista de aparición trimestral (aunque no se llegó a cumplir la periodicidad prevista), editada por Ludotecnia y distribuida por Distrimagen S.L.
Estaba principalmente enfocada a juegos de la propia editorial.

boardgame.rpg: Ragnarok (Juego De Horror En el Mundo Contemporáneo)

boardgame.name: Asuntos Internos (Número 4 - Oct 1997)
boardgame.description:
User Summary:

Asuntos Internos fue una revista de aparición trimestral (aunque no se llegó a cumplir la periodicidad prevista), editada por Ludotecnia y distribuida por Distrimagen S.L.
Estaba principalmente enfocada a juegos de la propia editorial.

En la sección de "Artículos" se desglosa el contenido de este número.

boardgame.name: Scarface 1920: The Enforcers Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Enforcers adds more depth to the multiplayer mode and important new features for the solo mode. The Enforcers Expansion Pack is composed of three characters, ALINA IVANKOVA, TOM LEE and “RAVEN” KWIATKOWSKI, with their three miniatures and their corresponding cards.

The Enforcers in multiplayer game

The Enforcers are three special characters that players can recruit throughout the game, like we usually do with the Jobs cards. The peculiarity is that they are part of a common market and that there are only three, so, as you can imagine, they are characters with outstanding skills, who have a notable impact in each game.

The Enforcers, as we said, will also have their own miniature and move around the board like the thugs. Their power on the board, that is, their strength on the streets of Chicago, lies in the fact that they all have a passive skill that can be activated at specific moments in the game. In addition, and as with vehicles, they cannot be eliminated from the game: they have come to the city to stay.

Each of the Enforcers comes with two additional cards: their Enforcer card, like that of the rest of the Right Hands, where their muscle and influence points are printed, as well as their skill and the effect it has on the crime rate; and a second card, where on one side we find how the mini works on the board in multiplayer games, and on the other,the specific rules of that Enforcer in solo games.

The Enforcers in solo mode

The second important new feature of this Expansion Pack has to do with the solo mode of Scarface 1920. The solo mode is based on a two-player game in which the other player is controlled by an AI (artificial intelligence) that builds a deck of cards with their own deck building system. This artificial intelligence will carry out its activity in Chicago like a player, but it will demonstrate a resource and organizational capacity superior to ours, forcing us to optimize our gang to the maximum to be able to overcome it.
With this Expansion Pack, the rival gang in solo mode will have the invaluable help of an Enforcer, whose miniature will be used to determine where the power of the rival gang is in the map. In this mode, as we have said before, the Enforcers have a card where their skills are explained, which have a different impact on the game: in solo mode, Alina Ivankova, for example, is capable of extorting the rival in the reorganization phase depending on the number of jobs he has.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Scarface 1920

boardgame.name: Wild: Serengeti – Meeple Set
boardgame.description:
A set of 21 extra Animeeples:
1 Lion
1 Giraffe
1 Gazelle
1 Rhinoceros
1 Jackal
1 Leopard
1 Crocodile
1 elephant
1 Wildebeest
1 Hyena
1 Baboon
1 Vulture
1 Warthog
1 Cheetah
1 Ostrich
1 Secretary Bird
1 Buffalo
1 Python

boardgame.name: Cristal
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Tras tomar control de la clínica Bienestar, el grupo de juego por fin tiene pistas para detener a Deluxe Vigilance y acabar de una vez por todas con sus operaciones encubiertas. Pero parece que alguien les ha dado el soplo y solo un equipo FES especialmente equipado puede hacerles frente antes de que vacíen sus oficinas en pleno Madrid… y desaparezcan otra vez.

boardgame.name: Sargento Slasher
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

En un «casoplón» de vacaciones a orillas del Lago Tahoe se está celebrando una fiesta. La cerveza de barril y el ponche alcoholizado corren a raudales. Blondie suena en el radio cassette mientras algunos adolescentes se menean en el dance floor y otros retozan en el sofá y en los dormitorios del piso de arriba. Los hay que vomitan, que ríen, que lloriquean… vamos, un fiestón. Afuera todo es paz, como corresponde a un rincón con encanto. Pero espera, ¿qué son esos pasos que se oyen cada vez más cerca? ¿Y ese pedazo de cuerpo pestilente y magullado, como si a Rambo se le hubieran sentado encima cien charlies? No, no puede ser, ¿pero no estaba muerto? Pero parece él, esa cara rabiosa, esa boca babeante… ¡sí, es el sargento Slasher! Y está corriendo hacia la casa con ganas de ver sangre y vísceras. Si eres uno de los protagonistas en esta fiesta solo podemos darte un consejo… ¡¡CORRE!!
Una aventura inspirada en el cine slasher pensada para ser jugada en una sola sesión.
Incluye todo lo que necesitas para jugarlo: la aventura, el reglamento y cuatro personajes pregenerados.
boardgame.rpgproducer: Ana Belén Herrera de la Cruz

boardgame.name: The Dead Meat Mavericks
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Cuando el último de vosotros salta la valla que rodea la mansión, ya no hay vuelta atrás…
Ricardo III cambiaba su reino por un caballo y vosotros sois capaces de dar la vida por un rato de wifi. Esa vieja casona en la que estáis entrando parece ser el único lugar en quilómetros a la redonda donde vuestro smartphone podrá podrá resucitar gracias a unas rayitas de cobertura. Pero cuidado, porque los teléfonos móviles quizás no sean los únicos resucitados de la casa, y si perdéis la vida no habrá forma de retuitearlo o publicarlo en Instagram. O quizás sí, quizás lo hagan ellos… The Dead Meat Mavericks.
boardgame.rpgproducer: Ana Belén Herrera de la Cruz

boardgame.name: Galactic Renaissance
boardgame.description:
Following Inis, Galactic Renaissance is the second installment of the "Political Trilogy" by designer Christian Martinez and publisher Matagot.

Throughout Galactic Renaissance, you build your team, adding new specialists — each one unique — to the core in your deck of cards. With this team, you discover new planets and systems, reconnect with lost civilizations, expand your influence, build embassies, and sow disorder in opposing factions — all in an effort to score victory points faster than your opponents. Sending emissaries to new planets, for example, allows you to discover new civilizations or cement relationships on known planets. Opponents may try to convince a planet to join them instead with their own emissaries, causing disorder in the process.

boardgame.name: Post Mortem
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Todos los habitantes de Granite Fall han asistido al entierro de Kylie. También vosotras, que habéis regresado a despedir a vuestra amiga después de haberos marchado del pueblo.

Llueve cansinamente sobre el cementerio. El viento os trae algunos cuchicheos: "mira su madre, está demasiado entera"... "qué pena de chiquilla"... "vaya tipo raro que hay ahí detrás"... Os giráis, un hombre os mira fijamente a lo lejos. Un escalofrío os recorre cuando le veis gesticular con la boca, os está diciendo algo. De repente os parece ver a Kylie flotando entre vosotras y el hombre, su cara retorcida en una mueca de angustia. Y en ese instante lo sabéis: algo terrible le ocurrió a vuestra amiga y tenéis que ayudarla a encontrar la paz. Os cogéis fuerte de las manos, sintiendo que estáis donde debéis estar.
boardgame.rpgdesigner: Ana Belén Herrera de la Cruz
boardgame.rpgproducer: Ana Belén Herrera de la Cruz

boardgame.name: Orgía caníbal en San Valentín
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Todo listo para vuestra cita romántica de San Valentín. Estáis para comeros con vuestros trajes de fiesta. Solo falta Susan, que llega tarde como siempre. De repente, veis llegar corriendo a su hermana, Mary. «Deprisa, tenéis que ayudarme a salvar a Susan, ¡se la van a comer», berrea. Os fijáis en que está llena de sangre y… ¡le falta una oreja!
Cinco minutos después, sin saber bien cómo ni por qué, os encontráis dentro de un coche, corriendo a toda pastilla hacia una casa donde está a punto de comenzar una orgía caníbal.
boardgame.rpgdesigner: Ana Belén Herrera de la Cruz
boardgame.rpgproducer: Ana Belén Herrera de la Cruz

boardgame.name: YASS - Yet another strange system
boardgame.description:
From the former publisher website: (translated with deepl)

YASS is a satirical role-playing game for perhaps advanced players¸ developed by Peter Nomigkeit. It does not claim¸ to be the best system on the market¸ nor does it throw 512 expansion boxes at the player. Once you have the rulebook (a booklet)¸ you can start and play¸ until you drop. All of these features are so player-friendly¸ that they are not at all market-driven. It is, after all, almost unrivaled in price.

YASS is a fun, light-hearted, non-politically correct RPG, which is set in a corrupted version of our world, where incompetency is considered a boon not a bane.

The old website is still online: http://www.mynetcologne.de/~nc-nomigkpe/yass/yass.htm

boardgame.name: Un susurro descarnado
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Los Stanhope no habéis terminado de desempaquetar vuestras cosas en la nueva casa cuando comenzáis a escuchar esas voces. Unos susurros ininteligibles que suenan aquí y allá. El segundo día en la casa las cajas de la mudanza aparecen fuera. ¿Será una señal para que os marchéis de vuestra preciosa, asequible y excéntrica casa? ¿Intentaréis quizás negociar una convivencia pacífica con vuestros lúgubres «compañeros de hogar»?
boardgame.rpgproducer: Ana Belén Herrera de la Cruz

boardgame.name: Una cuestion de honor
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Japón, periodo feudal. Una deuda con los yakuza pone ante un dilema al señor Akiyoshi, que tendrá que enviar a sus mejores guerreros para resolver una cuestión de honor que puede acabar con su reputación y su influencia en la corte.
boardgame.rpgproducer: Ana Belén Herrera de la Cruz

boardgame.name: Monuments: Super Deluxe Ressources
boardgame.description:
5 types of high quality realistic resources and 1 player token to replace the ones included in the base game.
25 Apples (Food)
25 Metal (Stone)
25 Wood
25 Bows & Arrows (Weapon)
25 Cloth (Sheep)
1 Crown

boardgame.name: Gaudium Ludendi
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book (translated with deepl):

Do you ever wish you could travel to faraway lands, explore strange planets, recover valuable treasures, uncover ancient secrets, rescue princesses from the clutches of mystical monsters, and put a stop to evil villains - in short, have all kinds of adventures without leaving the safe comfort of your living room? Then, of course, you can immerse yourself in an exciting book or be captivated by an action-packed movie.

However, if you would rather actively participate in the action instead of being condemned to passive watching, then you should definitely try out a tabletop role-playing game, also known as a tabletop role-playing game, pen & paper role-playing game or RPG for short, with your friends. Because unlike other board games or computer role-playing games, in this hobby you decide for yourself what happens in your story and how the world changes through the actions of your game characters, bound only by the limits of your imagination.

Like most games, however, role-playing needs a minimum set of rules to ensure fairness and a certain level of comprehensibility, so that events are not merely arbitrary. And it is exactly such rules that Gaudium Ludendi offers you. So open it right now and take your first step into a new, adventurous world...

More info available on the publisher´s website:
https://www.gaudiumludendi.de/01welcome/index

boardgame.name: Spy Guy
boardgame.description:
In Spy Guy you become a detective trying to find the person responsible for a series of crimes against people of your city. Find on the map as many clues as possible, which will help you find villain before he flee the city.

Spy Guy is a cooperative game that tests your observation skills and collaboration between players. On one meter board of Treflikowo look for clues, which would bring you closer to find perpetrator.

If you manage to catch up to Doktor Moritze you win the game!

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Outer Rim – Premium reputation tokens
boardgame.description:
16 premium reputation tokens

Promo pack was available for free with purchase of the Star Wars: Outer Rim – Unfinished Business expansion in participating outlets.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Star Wars: Outer Rim – Unfinished Business

boardgame.name: Pop-A-Tops: Dino Scores
boardgame.description:
Pop the top to “roll” the dice to choose a category, then race to grab the dinosaur card you think will score the highest!

The player with the highest score that matches the dice roll gets to keep the card. The player who collects the most cards at the end wins!

Which dinosaur is the biggest, or the fastest? Outsmart your opponents with your Dino Facts!

— description from the publisher

On a player's turn they roll the die which shows a category (size, speed, weight, attack, defence, player's chioce). Immediately each player has to grab a dinosaur with the highest value (or - in rule variant - active player tells everyone to grab highest/lowesst value) of the indicated parameter. When each player grabs one card, they flip them and check the value. The player that chose the best dinosaur keeps the card. The first player to keep 5 or 7 cards (depending on the number of players) wins the game.

— user summary

boardgame.name: Amastris: Queen of Herculea
Amazons vs Valkyries Character Spotlight: Amastris
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Character Spotlight series outline the main characters in the Amazons vs Valkyries setting, providing personalities and backgrounds which can serve as inspiration for your own adventures in this setting. Guidelines for using these characters as patrons, allies, or villains are also provided with D20 game statistics for each character at levels 4, 9, and 20.

In this issue, we take a detailed look at one of the most underrated and overlooked NPCs in the setting, Amastris of Herculea, Queen of Amastrasia.

Features:

Detailed character background
Campaign setting lore
Dozens of ideas for adventures
Personality traits
Use as a Patron, Ally, or Enemy
D20 stats at 4th, 9th, and 20th level

boardgame.name: Dark Cases: Tiefer Fall
boardgame.description:
A mysterious incident in the small town of Dennsberg! During a climbing tour on the Talbachhorn, Thomas Borgmann, Managing Director of the traditional soup manufacturer BORGMANN's, fell from a height of several meters. The local police department believes it was a tragic accident. But there are signs that point in a different direction...

Your criminalistic skills are required! As a team of experienced investigators, you know exactly what you have to do: Research, discuss, combine – and solve this mysterious case together!

boardgame.name: Stingers & Spores: Riparian Knights
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Riparian Knights is a mini-setting in the world of Stingers & Spores, the high fantasy insect game for the Savage Worlds rule system. This open-world sandbox details the arid kingdom of Riparia, a tiny realm deep in the sun-baked Sonoran Desert.

Riparian Knights gives everything GMs need to run their own desert adventures, including:

A detailed isometric map of Riparia and its seven counties
A rundown of all important towns and landmarks, from the rotten-log city of Bombalig, to the Saguaro Cactus fortress of Castle Spikenest
Descriptions of all important kingdom rulers and denizens, along with plot hooks to involve them in campaigns
Rules for seasonal weather hazards, from cold winter nights and deadly summer heat, to the seasonal rains and floods
15 new stat blocks for desert insect species, like Africanized Honey Bees, Jerusalem Crickets, and Tarantula Hawks


The second half of the book contains The March of the Soulstinger, a 31 page adventure that takes the heroes across Riparia, on a quest to exorcize a sacred weapon from the presence of three ghosts, and maybe preserve the barrier between the living and the dead in the process.

boardgame.name: Black Hart
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Foxhollow Wood has fallen under a dark cloud of strained silence. Travelers who have passed through tell of being watched from the shadows when no animals stir, no birds sing, and the trees appear to tremble with no wind to stir them. Local farmers speak of signs that the Black Hart, a fae creature of perversion, has returned.

Black Hart is a Q-Hunt, or Quick-Hunt, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 3rd-level characters. This encounter would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: La desaparición de Linda Warren
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Linda Warren, la gogó del Witch Club con la que sale alguien de tu grupo, quizás tú, ha desaparecido. Es su día libre de trabajo, así que quizás ha hecho una pequeña escapada sin avisar. Lo que comienza como una búsqueda despreocupada de vuestra amiga irá desencadenando en un laberinto de secretos y horror que os llevará al borde de la locura.
boardgame.rpgproducer: Ana Belén Herrera de la Cruz

boardgame.name: Unfinished Business
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A decrepit jail sits on an abandoned plot of land that is soon to be repurposed. A ghost wanders its derelict halls, filling the night with its anguished moans. Why does the ghost haunt these halls and how will it react to visitors intent upon demolishing the crumbling structure?

Q-Haunts are specialized encounters centered on a supernatural occurrence. With that, there comes an added element of danger with the incorporation of ‘haunting effects’. Similar to the stages of exhaustion, ‘haunting effects’ influence a character’s ability to deal with the shock and horror of the situation, and potentially having lasting effects. These are only optional rules for the DM to include, if desired.

Unfinished Business is a Q-Haunt, or Quick-Haunt, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 4th-level characters or higher. This encounter would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: Towns of Sundara
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sundara boasts many major cities, each of them places of wonder filled with strange sights not likely to be found anywhere else in the world. However, for every city on the map there are dozens of smaller towns and villages where people make their homes, earn their livings and raise their families. While they may be smaller in size and population, these towns are no less interesting (and have no less history) than many of the setting's cities. And in some cases, they may even have more.

The following ten towns can be used either as part of the growing Sundara: Dawn of a New Age setting, or modified for use in other settings if one desires. Each comes with a map, a unique history, notable NPCs, unique locations and even rumors that can act as potential jumping off points for side quests within the town.

This supplement is system-neutral and will work with the system-specific Sundara sourcebooks.
boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.name: El barrio
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Os criasteis en el peor barrio de la ciudad. Estabais siempre juntos, pero crecisteis y tuvisteis que elegir: os uníais a la policía o a la mafia. No había muchas más alternativas para salir de la miseria. Ahora, una guerra de bandas amenaza vuestro barrio y estáis destinados a encontraros de nuevo. Y de nuevo tendréis que decidir: amistad o muerte. Lo que está claro es que, pase lo que pase, vais a acabar salpicados de sangre.
boardgame.rpgproducer: Ana Belén Herrera de la Cruz

boardgame.name: Cenotafio
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Point Cipher es un famoso faro embrujado ubicado en un islote. El estado quiere deshacerse del fantasma del farero para sacarle rendimiento turístico a la isla, así que os ha contratado para hacer una limpieza espiritual. ¿Conseguiréis echar al fantasma? ¿Os arrastrará a su dimensión? ¿Es el destino de Point Cipher convertirse en «un rincón con encanto»? Jugad y decidid.
boardgame.rpgproducer: Ana Belén Herrera de la Cruz

boardgame.name: Isocianato
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Cae la noche en una barriada pobre de una gran ciudad india. Los habitantes, agotados, solo quieren dormir, pero un extraño suceso está a punto de cambiar la historia para siempre.
Una aventura dura y brutal que toca temas muy sensibles desde una perspectiva adulta; solo recomendada para adultos en pleno uso de sus facultades.

boardgame.name: Spinball
boardgame.description:
Spinball is a simple action game for two players. First, all balls are removed from the holes. Then the two opponents choose one of three color combinations. Then the balls are thrown apart by operating a lever and end up in the holes. If balls that don't match the color have fallen in, remove them again. The winner is the first to get the balls in the holes that match their chosen color combination.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Tank Duel: Tank Pack #2
boardgame.description:
Tank Duel Tank Pack #2: The Eastern Front adds a wide variety of German and Soviet vehicles to the acclaimed Tank Duel System, from the early war Panzer 38(t) to the monster ISU-122 M44 and Jagdpanther. In addition to new vehicles, Tank Pack #2 includes new scenarios covering the Battle of Brody, Stalingrad, Kursk, and more. Even better, Tank Pack #2 comes with a mini-campaign, where the outcome of each scenario affects the next. All scenarios follow the format from Tank Pack #1 and North Africa, so they are quick to set up and have streamlined scenario rules so you can play immediately. And of course, all the scenarios support true solitaire play with the Robata system.

Tank Pack #2 can be combined with Tank Duel: North Africa as well as Tank Pack #1, and multiple sets can be combined to create an endless variety of matchups.

The Scenarios in Tank Pack #2 use the new Infantry rules and AT Guns introduced in the North Africa expansion. To play these scenarios, you will need a copy of Tank Duel: Enemy in the Crosshairs with these new rules and guns integrated via one of the following:
Tank Duel Second Edition
Tank Duel Update Kit
Tank Duel North Africa
The Free Print and Play Update Kit

-description from publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Tank Duel
Tank Duel: Enemy in the Crosshairs
Tank Duel: Expansion #1 – North Africa
Tank Duel: Tank Pack #1

boardgame.name: Star Quest: Conquest
boardgame.description:
A turn-based Strategy game set in space. Conquer planets and overwhelm your opponents by controlling resources. Manage your resource points to build an army capable of controlling the galaxy.

From the start of your turn you'll gather your resource points for the round. You can spend them on placing new troops, buying new ships, or upgrading your research and development. Then use these troops to fight or take over new territories.

You can move as many troops into an area with opponents on it. After the movement phase begins the attack. Each player will roll dice for attacks. The dice roll required depends on the type of unit attacking. Most units require a 5 or a 6 on the dice for a successful hit. Each player will learn from these experiences to deploy a more effective strategy as the game moves on.

Over time the territories you take away from your enemies will lessen the amount of Resource Points they get per turn, diminishing their ability to fight back. You can win by getting the opponent to surrender (ends a game faster) or you can play it out, and chase them through the map to destroy the troops they have left and end the game. Moving a fleet ship costs 10 RP, so the opponent will eventually run out. You win when the other player is unable to make any moves.

boardgame.name: Cheese Factory
boardgame.description:
Choose a Chef (each with their own special ability, build cheese machines, collect ingredients to make the cheese and burn down your competitors factories with cheese fires!

Manage your hand of ingredients and build the most effective cheese factory to be the first player to make 20 points worth of cheese.

Another fun Jason Anarchy Games and Tiny Snek Comics team up.

boardgame.name: Man Enough
boardgame.description:
The Ultimate Social Adventure

MAN ENOUGH is a CD_ROM multimedia dating simulation featuring:

- The only first person interactive social adventure

- Almost an hour of live-action video: mountain bike riding, pain ball, skydiving

- Stimulating dialogue comes to life through digitized speech

- Visually stunning, 320 x 400 enhanced VGA graphics

--from the front and back of the box

boardgame.name: 100 Worlds of Wonder Situations
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With our newest supplement, explore whimsical worlds, save magic creatures and fight to lift the curse of an evil witch...

This supplement contains:

5 hand drawn maps of 5 different worlds of wonder (Candy Land, Fairy Land, Grim Realm, Toys Kingdom, Winter World),
20 situations connected to each of the 5 maps

boardgame.name: Amazing Standard Digital 002: Ying and Yang’s Chinese Cuisine
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this issue of Neighborhood Highlights, we are going to look at one of the prosperous Asian establishments and the entrepreneur that has made Neotropolis his home.

Ying and Yang’s Chinese Cuisine is a red brick building in the heart of the business district. The large glass windows allow plenty of natural light inside as well as to allow the citizens a peek into the luxurious interior. Stepping into Ying and Yang’s is like walking into a Chinese palace of the past. Beautiful statues and pictures fill the place. The artwork hanging on the walls is only rivaled by the uniforms worn by the staff.

This PDF contains everything you need to know about Ying and Yang’s Chinese Cuisine, in the Amazing Universe Campaign or any other superhero campaign.

boardgame.name: Naasii: A Coyote & Crow Dice Game
boardgame.description:
Naasii is a push-your-luck style game of chance. Inspired by traditional Indigenous games and classic American family games. You'll roll twelve-sided dice aiming to score sets or runs while not busting along the way. Highest score wins, but it's not all luck. You'll need to decide which numbers to pursue and when you've scored enough to keep ahead of the other players. You'll even be able to pick a lucky number that will get you a few extra points on other players' turns!

Designed by Connor Alexander (Cherokee Nation, creator of Coyote & Crow) with art from Wolf Tomoyaketu (Comanche and Apache) and development by Daryl Andrews, Naasii brings the mischievous spirt of both Coyote and Crow to life in this fast paced, high-spirited game for the whole family.

In addition, the dice in the game can serve as a full recommended playset of dice for the Coyote & Crow roleplaying game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Duke Dread
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF contains a full write-up of Duke Dread!

Each issue of Instant Villain: Includes full stats, background story, support cast write-up, and tactical and plot suggestions!

boardgame.name: Tales from the Smoking Wyrm (Issue 4 - Jun 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tales from the Smoking Wyrm is a fanzine inspired not just by the roleplaying game Dungeon Crawl Classics (DCC), but also by the wondrous fanzines of the past 40 years! While we focus on DCC, the material produced can be easily translated into any Old School Renaissance (OSR) system.

Issue #4 contains the following articles:

Trolls Delving deep into Scandinavian lore to explore troll folklore and myth. Trolls are so diverse a group that we had to build not one, but three classes to fit them all in!
On Trolls and Alternatives to Luck Part 1 of a new series exploring alternate ways that non-human races can use Luck
Organizations in DCC Another new series, exploring the concept of organizations in roleplaying in general, and discussing the salient features an organization needs to really be used effectively in any roleplaying game. We breathe some depth into two organizations presented in the DCC RPG rulebook and offer up a new one on top of that!
Ponteverdian Potted Meats High quality potted meats to keep your party going. Never adventure on an empty stomach again!
Expanding Familiars Two new familiar types, elemental motes and jinn
Culpepper’s Herbal More herbs for your game, featuring Black Alder and Wild Angelica
Onward Retainer An adventuring comic in the old school style, starring The Legion. Part 4, brought to you by Joel Phillips
Wyrm Words A word puzzle of all the Gygaxian words in this issue
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Por un puñado de granos de arroz
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

La expedición del magistrado llega a la villa de Yokina tento (la carpa feliz), un curioso pueblo bajo el mandato del samurái Tensumaru. Poco les cuesta a los personajes jugadores darse cuenta de que, de feliz, esta villa tiene poco, y menos cunado hace aparición un grupo de yakuza ue acusa a sus vecinos de haberles robado…

boardgame.name: Cuando aúllan los lobos
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

La expedición del magistrado llega al paso de la cordillera bajo un temporal de lluvia y vientos huracanados. Cuando llegan a Tōboe no machi, los reciben unos aullidos que dan escalofríos, y una desaparición misteriosa que está desatando la ida del dios de la montaña.

boardgame.name: Sangre de Long
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Unos enormes nubarrones de tormenta acechan las costas de Akenomyojō, un pueblo costero con uno de los puertos más concurridos a la capital. La diosa del mar, Suitengu, está furiosa porque ha desaparecido una de sus ningyo (sirenas) y amenaza con desatar su cólera contra el pueblo si no aparece. Pero se dice que la sangre de ningyo tiene propiedades curativas inigualables, y el magistrado no está dispuesto a dejarla ir así como así…

boardgame.name: Donde habita el alma
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

La tristeza y la desesperación se han apoderado del castillo de Jomei, señor de Shiro Hiei. Su hija Oyuki está gravemente enferma y ni las medicinas ni los rezos han surtido ningún efecto. Nadie parece capaz de ayudarla... por ahora. Solo quien descubra el oscuro secreto que se esconde tras su dolencia podrá salvarla, aunque para ello deba recurrir a poderes sobrenaturales.

boardgame.name: Haz que vuelva
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Kiri no Machi es un tranquilo pueblo de montaña al norte del Imperio. Es un lugar de retiro predilecto de los samuráis, que, centrados en alcanzar la iluminación, comparten pueblo con los heimin. Pero hace cinco días que desapareció uno de ellos con su daishō, y no se ha sabido nada de él desde entonces…

boardgame.name: En mi sueño...
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

A tan solo medio día de la capital, al final de su periplo por el Imperio, los personajes jugadores se topan con un kyuden que no aparece en los mapas y en el que, además, todo ha perdido el color. ¿Dónde están? ¿Se han perdido? La clave la tiene la dama Etsuko, pero primero deben encontrarla.

boardgame.name: Backscore
boardgame.description:
Backscore is a perfect-information game played on a 7x11 grid, in which each player controls a five-piece team and coach in a heavily abstracted sport scenario. Points are scored by moving a neutral 'ball' piece back into a section of one's own back row, having pieces kick it about.

Play is progressive - that is, the first player moves one piece, the second moves two, and thereafter each turn involves moving three pieces. Moves are 'slides', much like a queen in chess, but each piece must move as far as possible - meaning that the challenges of the game are less about speed (action is quick and can range rapidly around the board), and more about strategizing to keep good control over one's pieces and setting up good positionings.

Backscore is a more-complex descendant (different enough that it escapes being a plain variant, but close enough credit is important to give) of Neutron by Robert Krauss.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Glorious K'Chan
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Sois Glorious K’Chan, un grupo de música H-Pop que lleváis tiempo petándolo. Vuestra rentabilidad está comenzando a caer, así que Cibersongs, la megacorporación que os creó, ha ideado un plan para relanzaros o mataros. ¿Preparad@s? ¡Estáis en el aire!
boardgame.rpgproducer: Ana Belén Herrera de la Cruz

boardgame.name: Palm Island: Waterproof Box
boardgame.description: A water and dustproof bock to keep your game protected on the beach or where ever you go.

boardgame.name: Disney Sorcerer's Arena: Epic Alliances – Thrills & Chills Expansion
boardgame.description: Disney Sorcerer's Arena: Epic Alliances – Thrills & Chills Expansion adds three new characters to Disney Sorcerer's Arena: Epic Alliances: Mother Gothel, Jack Skellington, and one other.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Disney Sorcerer's Arena: Epic Alliances Core Set

boardgame.name: La búsqueda del huevo de Dragón
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A Orión, Ángela y Blaze les encanta jugar a Starport, sobre todo cuando el padre de Blaze, Kevin, dirige la partida. Pero esta misión no se parece a nada que hayan hecho antes.

Los valientes aventureros tienen que viajar al Reino de los Dragones para recuperar un huevo de dragón que robó un Dragón de cristal. El reino está lleno de criaturas asquerosas, desafiantes rompecabezas, ríos maravillosos, frutas deliciosas, junglas salvajes y montañas impresionantes.

Esta búsqueda se sitúa en el único y maravilloso mundo de Starport, y llevará a los héroes a una aventura llena de acción y contenido educativo como preguntas básicas de ciencias, resolución de problemas, pensamiento crítico ¡y mucho más!

boardgame.name: La ballena del sueño
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Una enorme ballena ha llegado a Starville provocando que todos sus habitantes caigan en una profunda apatía. Mientras, los Chimpancés pirata que viajaban con ella aprovechan para saquear la ciudad. ¿Podrán los personajes frustar los planes de su jefe, el Comandante Nas?

boardgame.name: La Mansión Ruperta
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Se acerca Halloween y Starport se prepara para celebrarlo. Pero algo ha ocurrido en el campo de Tinny el Espantapájaros: una calabaza gigante se ha transformado en una mansión en la que habitan unos seres muy extraños. Y además, amenaza con quedarse con todas las calabazas de caramelo. ¡Eso sí que es un problema! ¡Rápido, los niños de Starport os necesitan!

boardgame.name: La llegada del tren
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Un misterioso tren llega a la estación de Starport. De él sale un agitado duende que dice ser.. ¡un enviado de Santa Claus! Y parece que tiene problemas: el tren se ha averiado y no hay tiempo que perder si quieren salvar la Navidad.
¿Podréis ayudar al duende y resolver el problema? Adelante, este es solo el principio de una gran aventura que os llevará al mundo mágico de Santa Claus.

boardgame.name: Navegando por las estrellas
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Ya estáis a bordo del Polar Express, pero los problemas aún no han acabado. Con el retraso acumulado por la avería del tren en la anterior aventura, se ha hecho de día. El duende responsable del tren no sabe encontrar el camino sin la ayuda de las estrellas. ¿Qué se puede hacer? La solución está en el mismo tren, pero para ello, tendréis que explorar sus mágicos vagones, donde se esconden varias sorpresas.

boardgame.name: El juicio
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

¡Por fin llegáis al Polo Norte! Pero ojo, los problemas no han terminado aún. Todas las fábricas de juguetes están paradas, mientras los duendes de Navidad solo piensan en jugar. ¿Qué ha sucedido? ¿Por qué está tan alterado el príncipe Cascanueces? ¿Habrá vuelto a hacer de las suyas el Grinch? En vuestras manos está descubrirlo.

boardgame.name: El primer regalo
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Todavía queda un misterio por resolver: si no fue el Grinch ¿quién robó las piezas del reloj solar? y ¿por qué? Descubrirlo es vuestra tarea, pero daros prisa. En Villa Navidad siguen sucediendo cosas extrañas que ponen en peligro la misión de Santa Claus. Solo vosotros podéis salvarla.

boardgame.name: Chip & Collect
boardgame.description:
Bird battle with other greedy flocks using your Chip & Collect skills. Glide and grab chips and seaside Bonus Food, avoid bad food and an evil plastic bag! But don't drop the lot! When all the chip cards have been collected, the flock with the most Chip points wins.

The game is played in rounds that start with a bird battle of skill. The winning bird attempts to grab and hold seaside food worth chip points, and drop any Bad Food that will deduct chip points. The same player starts the next round and repeats the process until beaten in battle, where their turn ends. Their turn also ends if all Chip cards are dropped, only bad food is held, or all bird cards have been used or discarded.

boardgame.name: ArchRavels: Magic Socks
boardgame.description:
The knitting scene goes crazys when a family of crafting gnomes comes to town with magic socks to trade. How will your skills expand when your feet are full of magic?

The ArchRavels: Magic Socks expansion introduces a module in which players can trade their precious wool for enchanted footwear that doesn't just keep their toes warm: it gives them special rule-breaking powers.

This expansion also introduces two new character types, the Expert and the Maker, along with everything you need to play them. Take this opportunity to expand your table to welcome 5 or 6 players simultaneously! Don't worry, the 5-6 player rules keep the game about the same length, despite adding 50% more crafty goodness!

Finally, the Magic Socks expansion also includes some all new Special Projects to add a bit more variety to your knitting circle.

-description from publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: ArchRavels

boardgame.name: RisiKo! Più
boardgame.description:
Your objective is to fully occupy 3 Empires in addition to your own.

This game in the RisiKo! family of games is markedly different to the original RisiKo! as it has no territory cards, and players do not get armies based on the total number of individual territories, but instead for controlling regions, banners and castles.

The different cards in the game act as combat modifiers: Allow for players to carry on attacks that are otherwise not permitted, get reinforcement armies, force temporarily non-aggression pacts or look at another player's cards.

The game is remarkably similar to Castle Risk. There are, however, several differences -some of them rather substantial- between the two games. Just to describe a few of them (comprehensive list here):

The game's objectives (wining conditions) are different: Total conquest in Castle Risk vs a prefixed amount of conquests (Fully occupy 3 Empires in addition to your own) in RisiKo! Più.
"Spoils"/Reinforcements are to be reclaimed, in RisiKo! Più, in the beginning of each round, while in Castle Risk this is done at the end of the round instead.


—user summary

boardgame.name: FUSION: Clan War
boardgame.description:
FUSION: Clan War is a SciFi 3X Roll'n'write game centring around space combat in asteroid fields. Each round, players gather dice based on their expansions; roll the dice and take turns running commands. They can research technology, mine for resources, build ships and bases, move between asteroids, attack each other, and gain prestige. Destroy your opponent's bases or get to 20 Prestige to win the game!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Old Town Road
boardgame.description:
Old Town Road is an in-hand solo card game following your encounters with outlaws along the infamous road leading to Old Town.

On your turn, you’ll use an action on one of your 6 face up cards, shooting targets or robbing banks to flip cards to increase VPs or to put cards to the back of your deck creating sequences of 3-card poker hands, worth VPs at the end of the game. At the end of the game, you’ll calculate your score by adding up points for each of your poker sequences as well as VPs for wanted posters and bank robberies.

The game is comprised of 24 character cards, 4 establishment cards, and the Old Town reference card.

boardgame.name: Trickdraw
boardgame.description:
In Trickdraw, you collect gold and call on allies to become the local hero (or villain!) of the mercantile town Trickdraw Junction.

Cards can be played two different ways. Face down as gold (worth 1 point), or face up to perform actions. With only 10 points to win, any card you draw is guaranteed to push you toward victory.

The real trick comes not in how you use your cards the first time but in how you REUSE them. As you play, you’ll discover numerous ways to flip the cards in front of you. And whenever you flip a card face up, you can activate it again immediately!

You can also do the opposite. Flipping a spent card face down gives it new value as 1 point. This mechanic lets you find creative uses for your resources, giving all cards relative value. Your best card one turn may be better face down the next.

These tools allow for strong combos, sneaky plays, and cheeky bluffs. New strategy will emerge each time you play, and no game will feel quite like the last.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Rack Up
boardgame.description:
This matching-sets-for-points game is quick to learn and provides hours of play. Each card has a point value, with big game yielding more points than smaller game. The highest points go to the trophy rack buck. It’s a rare catch in this forest with only 2 available to hunt.

Each round players draw a card, create sets of cards to place down in front of them for scoring, and discard. A round ends when a player discards their last card. Any cards that are on the table in front of each player counts towards their score. Any cards left in their hand go against their score.

The first player to reach 1000 cumulative score, wins the game.

Contents: 104 card deck • Pen • Pad of paper for keeping score • Game Instructions.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Dirty Dragsters
boardgame.description:
Dirty Dragsters is a competitive drag racing card game with a simple play mechanic for 2 or more players

Each player’s race kit comes in its own unique mint tin, including a car, acceleration cards, Instruction booklet and track pieces.

Start by building the track using track cards from two or more tins. Each heat, players choose any acceleration cards in their hand that add up to 10. This represents their acceleration for the current race. The remaining cards (which also add to 10) will form their acceleration for the next heat.

Shuffle all players’ chosen cards together for the current drag race and deal them face-up one at a time. The face-up deal determines who moves down the track, by how much, and in which order. The player to cross the finish line first wins that heat.

The first player to win five heats wins the championship.

Each car deck comes in its own tin for travel. Any number of players can join the race with a different car. Collect them all!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Chaotic Studio
boardgame.description: Chaotic Studio is a drawing game that challenges players’ ability of image segmentation and deduction. According to chosen subject, each player must prepare a specific drawing in three parts on three separate transparent cards respectively. Then, other players try to guess what the Subject is when one of the three parts is revealed and the other two are displayed in a mix with other drawings scattered on the table! Longer before anyone gets the Subject correctly, more victory points (VP) the Active Player (the drawer) will score. However, the Active Player will gain no VP at all if no one guesses correctly.

boardgame.name: The Perfect Storm
boardgame.description:
Back Cover

The Drift is Broken

Galactic disaster strikes just as the crew of the Marata come under attack by pirates in the midst of a solar storm, and the survivors find themselves hurtling through time, space, and the planes! Soon they're being chased by infernal legions, fleeing the first layer of Hell to parallel dimensions and the distant future. All they want is to get home -- but first, they'll have to survive.

This Starfinder Adventure Path volume begins the Drift Crashers Adventure Path and includes:


"The Perfect Storm," a Starfinder adventure for 1st-level characters, by Jessica Redekop.



A player's guide for this Adventure Path, with advice on making characters perfect for the Drift Crash and the Drift Crisis that follows, by Joshua Hennington.



A toolbox featuring planar character options, diabolical fiends, and other creatures by Joseph Blomquist, Sasha Laranoa Harving, Quinn Murphy, Jessica Redekop, and Isabelle Thorne.



Statistics and deck plans for the Primorata, a unique vessel created when thow starships merged into one, housing an artifact called the Signal Chaos Engine, by Jessica Redekop.

boardgame.name: Starfinder Spell Cards Supplemental
boardgame.description:
Back of the Box

Just like the galaxy, the magic of Starfinder is infinite! Starfinder Spell Cards Supplemental is the must-have accessory for those spellcasting science-fantasy heroes whose knowledge has no bounds. More than 200 spell reference cards, covering a multitude of unique spells found in Starfinder's harccovers and Adventure Path volumes, gives players instance access to key game details at a glance!
